070/**
071 * View to an on-disk Region. Provides the set of methods necessary to interact with the on-disk
072 * region data.
073 */
074@InterfaceAudience.Private
075public class HRegionFileSystem {
076  private static final Logger LOG = LoggerFactory.getLogger(HRegionFileSystem.class);
077
078  /** Name of the region info file that resides just under the region directory. */
079  public final static String REGION_INFO_FILE = ".regioninfo";
080
081  /** Temporary subdirectory of the region directory used for merges. */
082  public static final String REGION_MERGES_DIR = ".merges";
083
084  /** Temporary subdirectory of the region directory used for splits. */
085  public static final String REGION_SPLITS_DIR = ".splits";
086
087  /** Temporary subdirectory of the region directory used for compaction output. */
088  static final String REGION_TEMP_DIR = ".tmp";
089
090  private final RegionInfo regionInfo;
091  // regionInfo for interacting with FS (getting encodedName, etc)
092  final RegionInfo regionInfoForFs;
093  final Configuration conf;
094  private final Path tableDir;
095  final FileSystem fs;
096  private final Path regionDir;
097
098  /**
099   * In order to handle NN connectivity hiccups, one need to retry non-idempotent operation at the
100   * client level.
101   */
102  private final int hdfsClientRetriesNumber;
103  private final int baseSleepBeforeRetries;
104  private static final int DEFAULT_HDFS_CLIENT_RETRIES_NUMBER = 10;
105  private static final int DEFAULT_BASE_SLEEP_BEFORE_RETRIES = 1000;
106
107  /**
108   * Create a view to the on-disk region
109   * @param conf       the {@link Configuration} to use
110   * @param fs         {@link FileSystem} that contains the region
111   * @param tableDir   {@link Path} to where the table is being stored
112   * @param regionInfo {@link RegionInfo} for region
113   */
114  HRegionFileSystem(final Configuration conf, final FileSystem fs, final Path tableDir,
115    final RegionInfo regionInfo) {
116    this.fs = fs;
117    this.conf = conf;
118    this.tableDir = Objects.requireNonNull(tableDir, "tableDir is null");
119    this.regionInfo = Objects.requireNonNull(regionInfo, "regionInfo is null");
120    this.regionInfoForFs = ServerRegionReplicaUtil.getRegionInfoForFs(regionInfo);
121    this.regionDir = FSUtils.getRegionDirFromTableDir(tableDir, regionInfo);
122    this.hdfsClientRetriesNumber =
123      conf.getInt("hdfs.client.retries.number", DEFAULT_HDFS_CLIENT_RETRIES_NUMBER);
124    this.baseSleepBeforeRetries =
125      conf.getInt("hdfs.client.sleep.before.retries", DEFAULT_BASE_SLEEP_BEFORE_RETRIES);
126  }
127
128  /** Returns the underlying {@link FileSystem} */
129  public FileSystem getFileSystem() {
130    return this.fs;
131  }
132
133  /** Returns the {@link RegionInfo} that describe this on-disk region view */
134  public RegionInfo getRegionInfo() {
135    return this.regionInfo;
136  }
137
138  public RegionInfo getRegionInfoForFS() {
139    return this.regionInfoForFs;
140  }
141
142  /** Returns {@link Path} to the region's root directory. */
143  public Path getTableDir() {
144    return this.tableDir;
145  }
146
147  /** Returns {@link Path} to the region directory. */
148  public Path getRegionDir() {
149    return regionDir;
150  }
151
152  // ===========================================================================
153  // Temp Helpers
154  // ===========================================================================
155  /** Returns {@link Path} to the region's temp directory, used for file creations */
156  public Path getTempDir() {
157    return new Path(getRegionDir(), REGION_TEMP_DIR);
158  }
159
160  /**
161   * Clean up any temp detritus that may have been left around from previous operation attempts.
162   */
163  void cleanupTempDir() throws IOException {
164    deleteDir(getTempDir());
165  }
166
167  // ===========================================================================
168  // Store/StoreFile Helpers
169  // ===========================================================================
170  /**
171   * Returns the directory path of the specified family
172   * @param familyName Column Family Name
173   * @return {@link Path} to the directory of the specified family
174   */
175  public Path getStoreDir(final String familyName) {
176    return new Path(this.getRegionDir(), familyName);
177  }
178
179  /**
180   * @param tabledir {@link Path} to where the table is being stored
181   * @param hri      {@link RegionInfo} for the region.
182   * @param family   {@link ColumnFamilyDescriptor} describing the column family
183   * @return Path to family/Store home directory.
184   */
185  public static Path getStoreHomedir(final Path tabledir, final RegionInfo hri,
186    final byte[] family) {
187    return getStoreHomedir(tabledir, hri.getEncodedName(), family);
188  }
189
190  /**
191   * @param tabledir    {@link Path} to where the table is being stored
192   * @param encodedName Encoded region name.
193   * @param family      {@link ColumnFamilyDescriptor} describing the column family
194   * @return Path to family/Store home directory.
195   */
196  public static Path getStoreHomedir(final Path tabledir, final String encodedName,
197    final byte[] family) {
198    return new Path(tabledir, new Path(encodedName, Bytes.toString(family)));
199  }
200
201  /**
202   * Create the store directory for the specified family name
203   * @param familyName Column Family Name
204   * @return {@link Path} to the directory of the specified family
205   * @throws IOException if the directory creation fails.
206   */
207  Path createStoreDir(final String familyName) throws IOException {
208    Path storeDir = getStoreDir(familyName);
209    if (!fs.exists(storeDir) && !createDir(storeDir))
210      throw new IOException("Failed creating " + storeDir);
211    return storeDir;
212  }
213
214  /**
215   * Set the directory of CF to the specified storage policy. <br>
216   * <i>"LAZY_PERSIST"</i>, <i>"ALL_SSD"</i>, <i>"ONE_SSD"</i>, <i>"HOT"</i>, <i>"WARM"</i>,
217   * <i>"COLD"</i> <br>
218   * <br>
219   * See {@link org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.protocol.HdfsConstants} for more details.
220   * @param familyName The name of column family.
221   * @param policyName The name of the storage policy: 'HOT', 'COLD', etc. See hadoop 2.6+
222   *                   org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.protocol.HdfsConstants for possible list e.g 'COLD',
223   *                   'WARM', 'HOT', 'ONE_SSD', 'ALL_SSD', 'LAZY_PERSIST'.
224   */
225  public void setStoragePolicy(String familyName, String policyName) {
226    CommonFSUtils.setStoragePolicy(this.fs, getStoreDir(familyName), policyName);
227  }
228
229  /**
230   * Set storage policy for a whole region. <br>
231   * <i>"LAZY_PERSIST"</i>, <i>"ALL_SSD"</i>, <i>"ONE_SSD"</i>, <i>"HOT"</i>, <i>"WARM"</i>,
232   * <i>"COLD"</i> <br>
233   * <br>
234   * See {@link org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.protocol.HdfsConstants} for more details.
235   * @param policyName The name of the storage policy: 'HOT', 'COLD', etc. See hadoop 2.6+
236   *                   org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.protocol.HdfsConstants for possible list e.g 'COLD',
237   *                   'WARM', 'HOT', 'ONE_SSD', 'ALL_SSD', 'LAZY_PERSIST'.
238   */
239  public void setStoragePolicy(String policyName) {
240    CommonFSUtils.setStoragePolicy(this.fs, getRegionDir(), policyName);
241  }
242
243  /**
244   * Get the storage policy of the directory of CF.
245   * @param familyName The name of column family.
246   * @return Storage policy name, or {@code null} if not using {@link HFileSystem} or exception
247   *         thrown when trying to get policy
248   */
249  @Nullable
250  public String getStoragePolicyName(String familyName) {
251    if (this.fs instanceof HFileSystem) {
252      Path storeDir = getStoreDir(familyName);
253      return ((HFileSystem) this.fs).getStoragePolicyName(storeDir);
254    }
255
256    return null;
257  }
258
259  /**
260   * Returns the store files available for the family. This methods performs the filtering based on
261   * the valid store files.
262   * @param familyName Column Family Name
263   * @return a set of {@link StoreFileInfo} for the specified family.
264   */
265  public List<StoreFileInfo> getStoreFiles(final String familyName) throws IOException {
266    return getStoreFiles(familyName, true);
267  }
268
269  /**
270   * Returns the store files available for the family. This methods performs the filtering based on
271   * the valid store files.
272   * @param familyName Column Family Name
273   * @return a set of {@link StoreFileInfo} for the specified family.
274   */
275  public List<StoreFileInfo> getStoreFiles(final String familyName, final boolean validate)
276    throws IOException {
277    Path familyDir = getStoreDir(familyName);
278    FileStatus[] files = CommonFSUtils.listStatus(this.fs, familyDir);
279    if (files == null) {
280      if (LOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
281        LOG.trace("No StoreFiles for: " + familyDir);
282      }
283      return null;
284    }
285
286    ArrayList<StoreFileInfo> storeFiles = new ArrayList<>(files.length);
287    for (FileStatus status : files) {
288      if (validate && !StoreFileInfo.isValid(status)) {
289        // recovered.hfiles directory is expected inside CF path when hbase.wal.split.to.hfile to
290        // true, refer HBASE-23740
291        if (!HConstants.RECOVERED_HFILES_DIR.equals(status.getPath().getName())) {
292          LOG.warn("Invalid StoreFile: {}", status.getPath());
293        }
294        continue;
295      }
296      StoreFileInfo info = ServerRegionReplicaUtil.getStoreFileInfo(conf, fs, regionInfo,
297        regionInfoForFs, familyName, status.getPath());
298      storeFiles.add(info);
299
300    }
301    return storeFiles;
302  }
303
304  /**
305   * Returns the store files' LocatedFileStatus which available for the family. This methods
306   * performs the filtering based on the valid store files.
307   * @param familyName Column Family Name
308   * @return a list of store files' LocatedFileStatus for the specified family.
309   */
310  public static List<LocatedFileStatus> getStoreFilesLocatedStatus(final HRegionFileSystem regionfs,
311    final String familyName, final boolean validate) throws IOException {
312    Path familyDir = regionfs.getStoreDir(familyName);
313    List<LocatedFileStatus> locatedFileStatuses =
314      CommonFSUtils.listLocatedStatus(regionfs.getFileSystem(), familyDir);
315    if (locatedFileStatuses == null) {
316      if (LOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
317        LOG.trace("No StoreFiles for: " + familyDir);
318      }
319      return null;
320    }
321
322    List<LocatedFileStatus> validStoreFiles = Lists.newArrayList();
323    for (LocatedFileStatus status : locatedFileStatuses) {
324      if (validate && !StoreFileInfo.isValid(status)) {
325        // recovered.hfiles directory is expected inside CF path when hbase.wal.split.to.hfile to
326        // true, refer HBASE-23740
327        if (!HConstants.RECOVERED_HFILES_DIR.equals(status.getPath().getName())) {
328          LOG.warn("Invalid StoreFile: {}", status.getPath());
329        }
330      } else {
331        validStoreFiles.add(status);
332      }
333    }
334    return validStoreFiles;
335  }
336
337  /**
338   * Return Qualified Path of the specified family/file
339   * @param familyName Column Family Name
340   * @param fileName   File Name
341   * @return The qualified Path for the specified family/file
342   */
343  Path getStoreFilePath(final String familyName, final String fileName) {
344    Path familyDir = getStoreDir(familyName);
345    return new Path(familyDir, fileName).makeQualified(fs.getUri(), fs.getWorkingDirectory());
346  }
347
348  /**
349   * Return the store file information of the specified family/file.
350   * @param familyName Column Family Name
351   * @param fileName   File Name
352   * @return The {@link StoreFileInfo} for the specified family/file
353   */
354  StoreFileInfo getStoreFileInfo(final String familyName, final String fileName)
355    throws IOException {
356    Path familyDir = getStoreDir(familyName);
357    return ServerRegionReplicaUtil.getStoreFileInfo(conf, fs, regionInfo, regionInfoForFs,
358      familyName, new Path(familyDir, fileName));
359  }
360
361  /**
362   * Returns true if the specified family has reference files
363   * @param familyName Column Family Name
364   * @return true if family contains reference files
365   */
366  public boolean hasReferences(final String familyName) throws IOException {
367    Path storeDir = getStoreDir(familyName);
368    FileStatus[] files = CommonFSUtils.listStatus(fs, storeDir);
369    if (files != null) {
370      for (FileStatus stat : files) {
371        if (stat.isDirectory()) {
372          continue;
373        }
374        if (StoreFileInfo.isReference(stat.getPath())) {
375          LOG.trace("Reference {}", stat.getPath());
376          return true;
377        }
378      }
379    }
380    return false;
381  }
382
383  /**
384   * Check whether region has Reference file
385   * @param htd table desciptor of the region
386   * @return true if region has reference file
387   */
388  public boolean hasReferences(final TableDescriptor htd) throws IOException {
389    for (ColumnFamilyDescriptor family : htd.getColumnFamilies()) {
390      if (hasReferences(family.getNameAsString())) {
391        return true;
392      }
393    }
394    return false;
395  }
396
397  /** Returns the set of families present on disk n */
398  public Collection<String> getFamilies() throws IOException {
399    FileStatus[] fds =
400      CommonFSUtils.listStatus(fs, getRegionDir(), new FSUtils.FamilyDirFilter(fs));
401    if (fds == null) return null;
402
403    ArrayList<String> families = new ArrayList<>(fds.length);
404    for (FileStatus status : fds) {
405      families.add(status.getPath().getName());
406    }
407
408    return families;
409  }
410
411  /**
412   * Remove the region family from disk, archiving the store files.
413   * @param familyName Column Family Name
414   * @throws IOException if an error occours during the archiving
415   */
416  public void deleteFamily(final String familyName) throws IOException {
417    // archive family store files
418    HFileArchiver.archiveFamily(fs, conf, regionInfoForFs, tableDir, Bytes.toBytes(familyName));
419
420    // delete the family folder
421    Path familyDir = getStoreDir(familyName);
422    if (fs.exists(familyDir) && !deleteDir(familyDir))
423      throw new IOException("Could not delete family " + familyName + " from FileSystem for region "
424        + regionInfoForFs.getRegionNameAsString() + "(" + regionInfoForFs.getEncodedName() + ")");
425  }
426
427  /**
428   * Generate a unique file name, used by createTempName() and commitStoreFile()
429   * @param suffix extra information to append to the generated name
430   * @return Unique file name
431   */
432  private static String generateUniqueName(final String suffix) {
433    String name = UUID.randomUUID().toString().replaceAll("-", "");
434    if (suffix != null) name += suffix;
435    return name;
436  }
437
438  /**
439   * Generate a unique temporary Path. Used in conjuction with commitStoreFile() to get a safer file
440   * creation. <code>
441   * Path file = fs.createTempName();
442   * ...StoreFile.Writer(file)...
443   * fs.commitStoreFile("family", file);
444   * </code>
445   * @return Unique {@link Path} of the temporary file
446   */
447  public Path createTempName() {
448    return createTempName(null);
449  }
450
451  /**
452   * Generate a unique temporary Path. Used in conjuction with commitStoreFile() to get a safer file
453   * creation. <code>
454   * Path file = fs.createTempName();
455   * ...StoreFile.Writer(file)...
456   * fs.commitStoreFile("family", file);
457   * </code>
458   * @param suffix extra information to append to the generated name
459   * @return Unique {@link Path} of the temporary file
460   */
461  public Path createTempName(final String suffix) {
462    return new Path(getTempDir(), generateUniqueName(suffix));
463  }
464
465  /**
466   * Move the file from a build/temp location to the main family store directory.
467   * @param familyName Family that will gain the file
468   * @param buildPath  {@link Path} to the file to commit.
469   * @return The new {@link Path} of the committed file
470   */
471  public Path commitStoreFile(final String familyName, final Path buildPath) throws IOException {
472    Path dstPath = preCommitStoreFile(familyName, buildPath, -1, false);
473    return commitStoreFile(buildPath, dstPath);
474  }
475
476  /**
477   * Generate the filename in the main family store directory for moving the file from a build/temp
478   * location.
479   * @param familyName      Family that will gain the file
480   * @param buildPath       {@link Path} to the file to commit.
481   * @param seqNum          Sequence Number to append to the file name (less then 0 if no sequence
482   *                        number)
483   * @param generateNewName False if you want to keep the buildPath name
484   * @return The new {@link Path} of the to be committed file
485   */
486  private Path preCommitStoreFile(final String familyName, final Path buildPath, final long seqNum,
487    final boolean generateNewName) throws IOException {
488    Path storeDir = getStoreDir(familyName);
489    if (!fs.exists(storeDir) && !createDir(storeDir))
490      throw new IOException("Failed creating " + storeDir);
491
492    String name = buildPath.getName();
493    if (generateNewName) {
494      name = generateUniqueName((seqNum < 0) ? null : StoreFileInfo.formatBulkloadSeqId(seqNum));
495    }
496    Path dstPath = new Path(storeDir, name);
497    if (!fs.exists(buildPath)) {
498      throw new FileNotFoundException(buildPath.toString());
499    }
500    if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
501      LOG.debug("Committing " + buildPath + " as " + dstPath);
502    }
503    return dstPath;
504  }
505
506  /*
507   * Moves file from staging dir to region dir
508   * @param buildPath {@link Path} to the file to commit.
509   * @param dstPath {@link Path} to the file under region dir
510   * @return The {@link Path} of the committed file
511   */
512  Path commitStoreFile(final Path buildPath, Path dstPath) throws IOException {
513    // rename is not necessary in case of direct-insert stores
514    if (buildPath.equals(dstPath)) {
515      return dstPath;
516    }
517    // buildPath exists, therefore not doing an exists() check.
518    if (!rename(buildPath, dstPath)) {
519      throw new IOException("Failed rename of " + buildPath + " to " + dstPath);
520    }
521    return dstPath;
522  }
523
524  /**
525   * Archives the specified store file from the specified family.
526   * @param familyName Family that contains the store files
527   * @param filePath   {@link Path} to the store file to remove
528   * @throws IOException if the archiving fails
529   */
530  public void removeStoreFile(final String familyName, final Path filePath) throws IOException {
531    HFileArchiver.archiveStoreFile(this.conf, this.fs, this.regionInfoForFs, this.tableDir,
532      Bytes.toBytes(familyName), filePath);
533  }
534
535  /**
536   * Closes and archives the specified store files from the specified family.
537   * @param familyName Family that contains the store files
538   * @param storeFiles set of store files to remove
539   * @throws IOException if the archiving fails
540   */
541  public void removeStoreFiles(String familyName, Collection<HStoreFile> storeFiles)
542    throws IOException {
543    HFileArchiver.archiveStoreFiles(this.conf, this.fs, this.regionInfoForFs, this.tableDir,
544      Bytes.toBytes(familyName), storeFiles);
545  }
546
547  /**
548   * Bulk load: Add a specified store file to the specified family. If the source file is on the
549   * same different file-system is moved from the source location to the destination location,
550   * otherwise is copied over.
551   * @param familyName Family that will gain the file
552   * @param srcPath    {@link Path} to the file to import
553   * @param seqNum     Bulk Load sequence number
554   * @return The destination {@link Path} of the bulk loaded file
555   */
556  Pair<Path, Path> bulkLoadStoreFile(final String familyName, Path srcPath, long seqNum)
557    throws IOException {
558    // Copy the file if it's on another filesystem
559    FileSystem srcFs = srcPath.getFileSystem(conf);
560    srcPath = srcFs.resolvePath(srcPath);
561    FileSystem realSrcFs = srcPath.getFileSystem(conf);
562    FileSystem desFs = fs instanceof HFileSystem ? ((HFileSystem) fs).getBackingFs() : fs;
563
564    // We can't compare FileSystem instances as equals() includes UGI instance
565    // as part of the comparison and won't work when doing SecureBulkLoad
566    // TODO deal with viewFS
567    if (!FSUtils.isSameHdfs(conf, realSrcFs, desFs)) {
568      LOG.info("Bulk-load file " + srcPath + " is on different filesystem than "
569        + "the destination store. Copying file over to destination filesystem.");
570      Path tmpPath = createTempName();
571      FileUtil.copy(realSrcFs, srcPath, fs, tmpPath, false, conf);
572      LOG.info("Copied " + srcPath + " to temporary path on destination filesystem: " + tmpPath);
573      srcPath = tmpPath;
574    }
575
576    return new Pair<>(srcPath, preCommitStoreFile(familyName, srcPath, seqNum, true));
577  }
578
579  // ===========================================================================
580  // Splits Helpers
581  // ===========================================================================
582
583  public Path getSplitsDir(final RegionInfo hri) {
584    return new Path(getTableDir(), hri.getEncodedName());
585  }
586
587  /**
588   * Remove daughter region
589   * @param regionInfo daughter {@link RegionInfo}
590   */
591  void cleanupDaughterRegion(final RegionInfo regionInfo) throws IOException {
592    Path regionDir = new Path(this.tableDir, regionInfo.getEncodedName());
593    if (this.fs.exists(regionDir) && !deleteDir(regionDir)) {
594      throw new IOException("Failed delete of " + regionDir);
595    }
596  }
597
598  /**
599   * Commit a daughter region, moving it from the split temporary directory to the proper location
600   * in the filesystem.
601   * @param regionInfo daughter {@link org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.RegionInfo}
602   */
603  public Path commitDaughterRegion(final RegionInfo regionInfo, List<Path> allRegionFiles,
604    MasterProcedureEnv env) throws IOException {
605    Path regionDir = this.getSplitsDir(regionInfo);
606    if (fs.exists(regionDir)) {
607      // Write HRI to a file in case we need to recover hbase:meta
608      Path regionInfoFile = new Path(regionDir, REGION_INFO_FILE);
609      byte[] regionInfoContent = getRegionInfoFileContent(regionInfo);
610      writeRegionInfoFileContent(conf, fs, regionInfoFile, regionInfoContent);
611      HRegionFileSystem regionFs = HRegionFileSystem.openRegionFromFileSystem(
612        env.getMasterConfiguration(), fs, getTableDir(), regionInfo, false);
613      insertRegionFilesIntoStoreTracker(allRegionFiles, env, regionFs);
614    }
615    return regionDir;
616  }
617
618  private void insertRegionFilesIntoStoreTracker(List<Path> allFiles, MasterProcedureEnv env,
619    HRegionFileSystem regionFs) throws IOException {
620    TableDescriptor tblDesc =
621      env.getMasterServices().getTableDescriptors().get(regionInfo.getTable());
622    // we need to map trackers per store
623    Map<String, StoreFileTracker> trackerMap = new HashMap<>();
624    // we need to map store files per store
625    Map<String, List<StoreFileInfo>> fileInfoMap = new HashMap<>();
626    for (Path file : allFiles) {
627      String familyName = file.getParent().getName();
628      trackerMap.computeIfAbsent(familyName, t -> StoreFileTrackerFactory.create(conf, tblDesc,
629        tblDesc.getColumnFamily(Bytes.toBytes(familyName)), regionFs));
630      fileInfoMap.computeIfAbsent(familyName, l -> new ArrayList<>());
631      List<StoreFileInfo> infos = fileInfoMap.get(familyName);
632      infos.add(new StoreFileInfo(conf, fs, file, true));
633    }
634    for (Map.Entry<String, StoreFileTracker> entry : trackerMap.entrySet()) {
635      entry.getValue().add(fileInfoMap.get(entry.getKey()));
636    }
637  }
638
639  /**
640   * Creates region split daughter directories under the table dir. If the daughter regions already
641   * exist, for example, in the case of a recovery from a previous failed split procedure, this
642   * method deletes the given region dir recursively, then recreates it again.
643   */
644  public void createSplitsDir(RegionInfo daughterA, RegionInfo daughterB) throws IOException {
645    Path daughterADir = getSplitsDir(daughterA);
646    if (fs.exists(daughterADir) && !deleteDir(daughterADir)) {
647      throw new IOException("Failed deletion of " + daughterADir + " before creating them again.");
648
649    }
650    if (!createDir(daughterADir)) {
651      throw new IOException("Failed create of " + daughterADir);
652    }
653    Path daughterBDir = getSplitsDir(daughterB);
654    if (fs.exists(daughterBDir) && !deleteDir(daughterBDir)) {
655      throw new IOException("Failed deletion of " + daughterBDir + " before creating them again.");
656
657    }
658    if (!createDir(daughterBDir)) {
659      throw new IOException("Failed create of " + daughterBDir);
660    }
661  }
662
663  /**
664   * Write out a split reference. Package local so it doesnt leak out of regionserver.
665   * @param hri         {@link RegionInfo} of the destination
666   * @param familyName  Column Family Name
667   * @param f           File to split.
668   * @param splitRow    Split Row
669   * @param top         True if we are referring to the top half of the hfile.
670   * @param splitPolicy A split policy instance; be careful! May not be full populated; e.g. if this
671   *                    method is invoked on the Master side, then the RegionSplitPolicy will NOT
672   *                    have a reference to a Region.
673   * @return Path to created reference.
674   */
675  public Path splitStoreFile(RegionInfo hri, String familyName, HStoreFile f, byte[] splitRow,
676    boolean top, RegionSplitPolicy splitPolicy) throws IOException {
677    Path splitDir = new Path(getSplitsDir(hri), familyName);
678    // Add the referred-to regions name as a dot separated suffix.
679    // See REF_NAME_REGEX regex above. The referred-to regions name is
680    // up in the path of the passed in <code>f</code> -- parentdir is family,
681    // then the directory above is the region name.
682    String parentRegionName = regionInfoForFs.getEncodedName();
683    // Write reference with same file id only with the other region name as
684    // suffix and into the new region location (under same family).
685    Path p = new Path(splitDir, f.getPath().getName() + "." + parentRegionName);
686    if (fs.exists(p)) {
687      LOG.warn("Found an already existing split file for {}. Assuming this is a recovery.", p);
688      return p;
689    }
690    boolean createLinkFile = false;
691    if (splitPolicy == null || !splitPolicy.skipStoreFileRangeCheck(familyName)) {
692      // Check whether the split row lies in the range of the store file
693      // If it is outside the range, return directly.
694      f.initReader();
695      try {
696        Cell splitKey = PrivateCellUtil.createFirstOnRow(splitRow);
697        Optional<ExtendedCell> lastKey = f.getLastKey();
698        Optional<ExtendedCell> firstKey = f.getFirstKey();
699        if (top) {
700          // check if larger than last key.
701          // If lastKey is null means storefile is empty.
702          if (!lastKey.isPresent()) {
703            return null;
704          }
705          if (f.getComparator().compare(splitKey, lastKey.get()) > 0) {
706            return null;
707          }
708          if (firstKey.isPresent() && f.getComparator().compare(splitKey, firstKey.get()) <= 0) {
709            LOG.debug("Will create HFileLink file for {}, top=true", f.getPath());
710            createLinkFile = true;
711          }
712        } else {
713          // check if smaller than first key
714          // If firstKey is null means storefile is empty.
715          if (!firstKey.isPresent()) {
716            return null;
717          }
718          if (f.getComparator().compare(splitKey, firstKey.get()) < 0) {
719            return null;
720          }
721          if (lastKey.isPresent() && f.getComparator().compare(splitKey, lastKey.get()) >= 0) {
722            LOG.debug("Will create HFileLink file for {}, top=false", f.getPath());
723            createLinkFile = true;
724          }
725        }
726      } finally {
727        f.closeStoreFile(f.getCacheConf() != null ? f.getCacheConf().shouldEvictOnClose() : true);
728      }
729    }
730    if (createLinkFile) {
731      // create HFileLink file instead of Reference file for child
732      String hfileName = f.getPath().getName();
733      TableName linkedTable = regionInfoForFs.getTable();
734      String linkedRegion = regionInfoForFs.getEncodedName();
735      try {
736        if (HFileLink.isHFileLink(hfileName)) {
737          Matcher m = LINK_NAME_PATTERN.matcher(hfileName);
738          if (!m.matches()) {
739            throw new IllegalArgumentException(hfileName + " is not a valid HFileLink name!");
740          }
741          linkedTable = TableName.valueOf(m.group(1), m.group(2));
742          linkedRegion = m.group(3);
743          hfileName = m.group(4);
744        }
745        // must create back reference here
746        HFileLink.create(conf, fs, splitDir, familyName, hri.getTable().getNameAsString(),
747          hri.getEncodedName(), linkedTable, linkedRegion, hfileName, true);
748        Path path =
749          new Path(splitDir, HFileLink.createHFileLinkName(linkedTable, linkedRegion, hfileName));
750        LOG.info("Created linkFile:" + path.toString() + " for child: " + hri.getEncodedName()
751          + ", parent: " + regionInfoForFs.getEncodedName());
752        return path;
753      } catch (IOException e) {
754        // if create HFileLink file failed, then just skip the error and create Reference file
755        LOG.error("Create link file for " + hfileName + " for child " + hri.getEncodedName()
756          + "failed, will create Reference file", e);
757      }
758    }
759    // A reference to the bottom half of the hsf store file.
760    Reference r =
761      top ? Reference.createTopReference(splitRow) : Reference.createBottomReference(splitRow);
762    return r.write(fs, p);
763  }
764
765  // ===========================================================================
766  // Merge Helpers
767  // ===========================================================================
768
769  Path getMergesDir(final RegionInfo hri) {
770    return new Path(getTableDir(), hri.getEncodedName());
771  }
772
773  /**
774   * Remove merged region
775   * @param mergedRegion {@link RegionInfo}
776   */
777  public void cleanupMergedRegion(final RegionInfo mergedRegion) throws IOException {
778    Path regionDir = new Path(this.tableDir, mergedRegion.getEncodedName());
779    if (this.fs.exists(regionDir) && !this.fs.delete(regionDir, true)) {
780      throw new IOException("Failed delete of " + regionDir);
781    }
782  }
783
784  static boolean mkdirs(FileSystem fs, Configuration conf, Path dir) throws IOException {
785    if (
786      FSUtils.isDistributedFileSystem(fs)
787        || !conf.getBoolean(HConstants.ENABLE_DATA_FILE_UMASK, false)
788    ) {
789      return fs.mkdirs(dir);
790    }
791    FsPermission perms = CommonFSUtils.getFilePermissions(fs, conf, HConstants.DATA_FILE_UMASK_KEY);
792    return fs.mkdirs(dir, perms);
793  }
794
795  /**
796   * Write out a merge reference under the given merges directory.
797   * @param mergingRegion {@link RegionInfo} for one of the regions being merged.
798   * @param familyName    Column Family Name
799   * @param f             File to create reference.
800   * @return Path to created reference.
801   * @throws IOException if the merge write fails.
802   */
803  public Path mergeStoreFile(RegionInfo mergingRegion, String familyName, HStoreFile f)
804    throws IOException {
805    Path referenceDir = new Path(getMergesDir(regionInfoForFs), familyName);
806    // A whole reference to the store file.
807    Reference r = Reference.createTopReference(mergingRegion.getStartKey());
808    // Add the referred-to regions name as a dot separated suffix.
809    // See REF_NAME_REGEX regex above. The referred-to regions name is
810    // up in the path of the passed in <code>f</code> -- parentdir is family,
811    // then the directory above is the region name.
812    String mergingRegionName = mergingRegion.getEncodedName();
813    // Write reference with same file id only with the other region name as
814    // suffix and into the new region location (under same family).
815    Path p = new Path(referenceDir, f.getPath().getName() + "." + mergingRegionName);
816    return r.write(fs, p);
817  }
818
819  /**
820   * Commit a merged region, making it ready for use.
821   */
822  public void commitMergedRegion(List<Path> allMergedFiles, MasterProcedureEnv env)
823    throws IOException {
824    Path regionDir = getMergesDir(regionInfoForFs);
825    if (regionDir != null && fs.exists(regionDir)) {
826      // Write HRI to a file in case we need to recover hbase:meta
827      Path regionInfoFile = new Path(regionDir, REGION_INFO_FILE);
828      byte[] regionInfoContent = getRegionInfoFileContent(regionInfo);
829      writeRegionInfoFileContent(conf, fs, regionInfoFile, regionInfoContent);
830      insertRegionFilesIntoStoreTracker(allMergedFiles, env, this);
831    }
832  }
833
834  // ===========================================================================
835  // Create/Open/Delete Helpers
836  // ===========================================================================
837
838  /** Returns Content of the file we write out to the filesystem under a region */
839  private static byte[] getRegionInfoFileContent(final RegionInfo hri) throws IOException {
840    return RegionInfo.toDelimitedByteArray(hri);
841  }
842
843  /**
844   * Create a {@link RegionInfo} from the serialized version on-disk.
845   * @param fs        {@link FileSystem} that contains the Region Info file
846   * @param regionDir {@link Path} to the Region Directory that contains the Info file
847   * @return An {@link RegionInfo} instance gotten from the Region Info file.
848   * @throws IOException if an error occurred during file open/read operation.
849   */
850  public static RegionInfo loadRegionInfoFileContent(final FileSystem fs, final Path regionDir)
851    throws IOException {
852    FSDataInputStream in = fs.open(new Path(regionDir, REGION_INFO_FILE));
853    try {
854      return RegionInfo.parseFrom(in);
855    } finally {
856      in.close();
857    }
858  }
859
860  /**
861   * Write the .regioninfo file on-disk.
862   * <p/>
863   * Overwrites if exists already.
864   */
865  private static void writeRegionInfoFileContent(final Configuration conf, final FileSystem fs,
866    final Path regionInfoFile, final byte[] content) throws IOException {
867    // First check to get the permissions
868    FsPermission perms = CommonFSUtils.getFilePermissions(fs, conf, HConstants.DATA_FILE_UMASK_KEY);
869    // Write the RegionInfo file content
870    try (FSDataOutputStream out = FSUtils.create(conf, fs, regionInfoFile, perms, null)) {
871      out.write(content);
872    }
873  }
874
875  /**
876   * Write out an info file under the stored region directory. Useful recovering mangled regions. If
877   * the regionInfo already exists on-disk, then we fast exit.
878   */
879  void checkRegionInfoOnFilesystem() throws IOException {
880    // Compose the content of the file so we can compare to length in filesystem. If not same,
881    // rewrite it (it may have been written in the old format using Writables instead of pb). The
882    // pb version is much shorter -- we write now w/o the toString version -- so checking length
883    // only should be sufficient. I don't want to read the file every time to check if it pb
884    // serialized.
885    byte[] content = getRegionInfoFileContent(regionInfoForFs);
886
887    // Verify if the region directory exists before opening a region. We need to do this since if
888    // the region directory doesn't exist we will re-create the region directory and a new HRI
889    // when HRegion.openHRegion() is called.
890    try {
891      FileStatus status = fs.getFileStatus(getRegionDir());
892    } catch (FileNotFoundException e) {
893      LOG.warn(getRegionDir() + " doesn't exist for region: " + regionInfoForFs.getEncodedName()
894        + " on table " + regionInfo.getTable());
895    }
896
897    try {
898      Path regionInfoFile = new Path(getRegionDir(), REGION_INFO_FILE);
899      FileStatus status = fs.getFileStatus(regionInfoFile);
900      if (status != null && status.getLen() == content.length) {
901        // Then assume the content good and move on.
902        // NOTE: that the length is not sufficient to define the the content matches.
903        return;
904      }
905
906      LOG.info("Rewriting .regioninfo file at: " + regionInfoFile);
907      if (!fs.delete(regionInfoFile, false)) {
908        throw new IOException("Unable to remove existing " + regionInfoFile);
909      }
910    } catch (FileNotFoundException e) {
911      LOG.warn(REGION_INFO_FILE + " file not found for region: " + regionInfoForFs.getEncodedName()
912        + " on table " + regionInfo.getTable());
913    }
914
915    // Write HRI to a file in case we need to recover hbase:meta
916    writeRegionInfoOnFilesystem(content, true);
917  }
918
919  /**
920   * Write out an info file under the region directory. Useful recovering mangled regions.
921   * @param useTempDir indicate whether or not using the region .tmp dir for a safer file creation.
922   */
923  private void writeRegionInfoOnFilesystem(boolean useTempDir) throws IOException {
924    byte[] content = getRegionInfoFileContent(regionInfoForFs);
925    writeRegionInfoOnFilesystem(content, useTempDir);
926  }
927
928  /**
929   * Write out an info file under the region directory. Useful recovering mangled regions.
930   * @param regionInfoContent serialized version of the {@link RegionInfo}
931   * @param useTempDir        indicate whether or not using the region .tmp dir for a safer file
932   *                          creation.
933   */
934  private void writeRegionInfoOnFilesystem(final byte[] regionInfoContent, final boolean useTempDir)
935    throws IOException {
936    Path regionInfoFile = new Path(getRegionDir(), REGION_INFO_FILE);
937    if (useTempDir) {
938      // Create in tmpDir and then move into place in case we crash after
939      // create but before close. If we don't successfully close the file,
940      // subsequent region reopens will fail the below because create is
941      // registered in NN.
942
943      // And then create the file
944      Path tmpPath = new Path(getTempDir(), REGION_INFO_FILE);
945
946      // If datanode crashes or if the RS goes down just before the close is called while trying to
947      // close the created regioninfo file in the .tmp directory then on next
948      // creation we will be getting AlreadyCreatedException.
949      // Hence delete and create the file if exists.
950      if (CommonFSUtils.isExists(fs, tmpPath)) {
951        CommonFSUtils.delete(fs, tmpPath, true);
952      }
953
954      // Write HRI to a file in case we need to recover hbase:meta
955      writeRegionInfoFileContent(conf, fs, tmpPath, regionInfoContent);
956
957      // Move the created file to the original path
958      if (fs.exists(tmpPath) && !rename(tmpPath, regionInfoFile)) {
959        throw new IOException("Unable to rename " + tmpPath + " to " + regionInfoFile);
960      }
961    } else {
962      // Write HRI to a file in case we need to recover hbase:meta
963      writeRegionInfoFileContent(conf, fs, regionInfoFile, regionInfoContent);
964    }
965  }
966
967  /**
968   * Create a new Region on file-system.
969   * @param conf       the {@link Configuration} to use
970   * @param fs         {@link FileSystem} from which to add the region
971   * @param tableDir   {@link Path} to where the table is being stored
972   * @param regionInfo {@link RegionInfo} for region to be added
973   * @throws IOException if the region creation fails due to a FileSystem exception.
974   */
975  public static HRegionFileSystem createRegionOnFileSystem(final Configuration conf,
976    final FileSystem fs, final Path tableDir, final RegionInfo regionInfo) throws IOException {
977    HRegionFileSystem regionFs = new HRegionFileSystem(conf, fs, tableDir, regionInfo);
978
979    // We only create a .regioninfo and the region directory if this is the default region replica
980    if (regionInfo.getReplicaId() == RegionInfo.DEFAULT_REPLICA_ID) {
981      Path regionDir = regionFs.getRegionDir();
982      if (fs.exists(regionDir)) {
983        LOG.warn("Trying to create a region that already exists on disk: " + regionDir);
984      } else {
985        // Create the region directory
986        if (!createDirOnFileSystem(fs, conf, regionDir)) {
987          LOG.warn("Unable to create the region directory: " + regionDir);
988          throw new IOException("Unable to create region directory: " + regionDir);
989        }
990      }
991
992      // Write HRI to a file in case we need to recover hbase:meta
993      regionFs.writeRegionInfoOnFilesystem(false);
994    } else {
995      if (LOG.isDebugEnabled())
996        LOG.debug("Skipping creation of .regioninfo file for " + regionInfo);
997    }
998    return regionFs;
999  }
1000
1001  /**
1002   * Open Region from file-system.
1003   * @param conf       the {@link Configuration} to use
1004   * @param fs         {@link FileSystem} from which to add the region
1005   * @param tableDir   {@link Path} to where the table is being stored
1006   * @param regionInfo {@link RegionInfo} for region to be added
1007   * @param readOnly   True if you don't want to edit the region data
1008   * @throws IOException if the region creation fails due to a FileSystem exception.
1009   */
1010  public static HRegionFileSystem openRegionFromFileSystem(final Configuration conf,
1011    final FileSystem fs, final Path tableDir, final RegionInfo regionInfo, boolean readOnly)
1012    throws IOException {
1013    HRegionFileSystem regionFs = new HRegionFileSystem(conf, fs, tableDir, regionInfo);
1014    Path regionDir = regionFs.getRegionDir();
1015
1016    if (!fs.exists(regionDir)) {
1017      LOG.warn("Trying to open a region that do not exists on disk: " + regionDir);
1018      throw new IOException("The specified region do not exists on disk: " + regionDir);
1019    }
1020
1021    if (!readOnly) {
1022      // Cleanup temporary directories
1023      regionFs.cleanupTempDir();
1024
1025      // If it doesn't exists, Write HRI to a file, in case we need to recover hbase:meta
1026      // Only create HRI if we are the default replica
1027      if (regionInfo.getReplicaId() == RegionInfo.DEFAULT_REPLICA_ID) {
1028        regionFs.checkRegionInfoOnFilesystem();
1029      } else {
1030        if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
1031          LOG.debug("Skipping creation of .regioninfo file for " + regionInfo);
1032        }
1033      }
1034    }
1035
1036    return regionFs;
1037  }
1038
1039  /**
1040   * Remove the region from the table directory, archiving the region's hfiles.
1041   * @param conf       the {@link Configuration} to use
1042   * @param fs         {@link FileSystem} from which to remove the region
1043   * @param tableDir   {@link Path} to where the table is being stored
1044   * @param regionInfo {@link RegionInfo} for region to be deleted
1045   * @throws IOException if the request cannot be completed
1046   */
1047  public static void deleteRegionFromFileSystem(final Configuration conf, final FileSystem fs,
1048    final Path tableDir, final RegionInfo regionInfo) throws IOException {
1049    HRegionFileSystem regionFs = new HRegionFileSystem(conf, fs, tableDir, regionInfo);
1050    Path regionDir = regionFs.getRegionDir();
1051
1052    if (!fs.exists(regionDir)) {
1053      LOG.warn("Trying to delete a region that do not exists on disk: " + regionDir);
1054      return;
1055    }
1056
1057    if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
1058      LOG.debug("DELETING region " + regionDir);
1059    }
1060
1061    // Archive region
1062    Path rootDir = CommonFSUtils.getRootDir(conf);
1063    HFileArchiver.archiveRegion(fs, rootDir, tableDir, regionDir);
1064
1065    // Delete empty region dir
1066    if (!fs.delete(regionDir, true)) {
1067      LOG.warn("Failed delete of " + regionDir);
1068    }
1069  }
1070
1071  /**
1072   * Creates a directory. Assumes the user has already checked for this directory existence.
1073   * @return the result of fs.mkdirs(). In case underlying fs throws an IOException, it checks
1074   *         whether the directory exists or not, and returns true if it exists.
1075   */
1076  boolean createDir(Path dir) throws IOException {
1077    int i = 0;
1078    IOException lastIOE = null;
1079    do {
1080      try {
1081        return mkdirs(fs, conf, dir);
1082      } catch (IOException ioe) {
1083        lastIOE = ioe;
1084        if (fs.exists(dir)) return true; // directory is present
1085        try {
1086          sleepBeforeRetry("Create Directory", i + 1);
1087        } catch (InterruptedException e) {
1088          throw (InterruptedIOException) new InterruptedIOException().initCause(e);
1089        }
1090      }
1091    } while (++i <= hdfsClientRetriesNumber);
1092    throw new IOException("Exception in createDir", lastIOE);
1093  }
1094
1095  /**
1096   * Renames a directory. Assumes the user has already checked for this directory existence.
1097   * @return true if rename is successful.
1098   */
1099  boolean rename(Path srcpath, Path dstPath) throws IOException {
1100    IOException lastIOE = null;
1101    int i = 0;
1102    do {
1103      try {
1104        return fs.rename(srcpath, dstPath);
1105      } catch (IOException ioe) {
1106        lastIOE = ioe;
1107        if (!fs.exists(srcpath) && fs.exists(dstPath)) return true; // successful move
1108        // dir is not there, retry after some time.
1109        try {
1110          sleepBeforeRetry("Rename Directory", i + 1);
1111        } catch (InterruptedException e) {
1112          throw (InterruptedIOException) new InterruptedIOException().initCause(e);
1113        }
1114      }
1115    } while (++i <= hdfsClientRetriesNumber);
1116
1117    throw new IOException("Exception in rename", lastIOE);
1118  }
1119
1120  /**
1121   * Deletes a directory. Assumes the user has already checked for this directory existence.
1122   * @return true if the directory is deleted.
1123   */
1124  boolean deleteDir(Path dir) throws IOException {
1125    IOException lastIOE = null;
1126    int i = 0;
1127    do {
1128      try {
1129        return fs.delete(dir, true);
1130      } catch (IOException ioe) {
1131        lastIOE = ioe;
1132        if (!fs.exists(dir)) return true;
1133        // dir is there, retry deleting after some time.
1134        try {
1135          sleepBeforeRetry("Delete Directory", i + 1);
1136        } catch (InterruptedException e) {
1137          throw (InterruptedIOException) new InterruptedIOException().initCause(e);
1138        }
1139      }
1140    } while (++i <= hdfsClientRetriesNumber);
1141
1142    throw new IOException("Exception in DeleteDir", lastIOE);
1143  }
1144
1145  /**
1146   * sleeping logic; handles the interrupt exception.
1147   */
1148  private void sleepBeforeRetry(String msg, int sleepMultiplier) throws InterruptedException {
1149    sleepBeforeRetry(msg, sleepMultiplier, baseSleepBeforeRetries, hdfsClientRetriesNumber);
1150  }
1151
1152  /**
1153   * Creates a directory for a filesystem and configuration object. Assumes the user has already
1154   * checked for this directory existence.
1155   * @return the result of fs.mkdirs(). In case underlying fs throws an IOException, it checks
1156   *         whether the directory exists or not, and returns true if it exists.
1157   */
1158  private static boolean createDirOnFileSystem(FileSystem fs, Configuration conf, Path dir)
1159    throws IOException {
1160    int i = 0;
1161    IOException lastIOE = null;
1162    int hdfsClientRetriesNumber =
1163      conf.getInt("hdfs.client.retries.number", DEFAULT_HDFS_CLIENT_RETRIES_NUMBER);
1164    int baseSleepBeforeRetries =
1165      conf.getInt("hdfs.client.sleep.before.retries", DEFAULT_BASE_SLEEP_BEFORE_RETRIES);
1166    do {
1167      try {
1168        return fs.mkdirs(dir);
1169      } catch (IOException ioe) {
1170        lastIOE = ioe;
1171        if (fs.exists(dir)) return true; // directory is present
1172        try {
1173          sleepBeforeRetry("Create Directory", i + 1, baseSleepBeforeRetries,
1174            hdfsClientRetriesNumber);
1175        } catch (InterruptedException e) {
1176          throw (InterruptedIOException) new InterruptedIOException().initCause(e);
1177        }
1178      }
1179    } while (++i <= hdfsClientRetriesNumber);
1180
1181    throw new IOException("Exception in createDir", lastIOE);
1182  }
1183
1184  /**
1185   * sleeping logic for static methods; handles the interrupt exception. Keeping a static version
1186   * for this to avoid re-looking for the integer values.
1187   */
1188  private static void sleepBeforeRetry(String msg, int sleepMultiplier, int baseSleepBeforeRetries,
1189    int hdfsClientRetriesNumber) throws InterruptedException {
1190    if (sleepMultiplier > hdfsClientRetriesNumber) {
1191      if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
1192        LOG.debug(msg + ", retries exhausted");
1193      }
1194      return;
1195    }
1196    if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
1197      LOG.debug(msg + ", sleeping " + baseSleepBeforeRetries + " times " + sleepMultiplier);
1198    }
1199    Thread.sleep((long) baseSleepBeforeRetries * sleepMultiplier);
1200  }
1201}
